bibl.title: Rush and Reed: the Pens of Egyptian and Greek Scribes.
bibl.note: Possibilities and problems that arise in studying the use of the two different kinds of pen: the Egyptian type, made of rush, and the Greek type, made of reed.

bibl.title: Proceedings of the XVIII International Congress of Papyrology. II

bibl.seg: Tait William John, Rush and Reed: the Pens of Egyptian and Greek Scribes.
Proceedings of the XVIII International Congress of Papyrology. II (Athens, 1988) pp. 477-481.
Possibilities and problems that arise in studying the use of the two different kinds of pen: the Egyptian type, made of rush, and the Greek type, made of reed.
